info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Alexander, southern Iredell and northwestern Mecklenburg Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Newton to 17 miles northwest of Huntersville to 5 miles south of Lincolnton. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntersville, Statesville, Cornelius, Mooresville, Davidson, Troutman, Lake Norman State Park, Lookout Shoals Lake, Ramsey Creek Park and Lake Norman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
